bwwExcerpt: Over the course of this juicy soul jukebox show, we'll watch irresistible performances of the Detroit-born classics that brought "race music" into the mainstream, from Jackie Wilson's "Reet Petite" to the Supremes's "Stop In The Name Of Love" and the Jackson Five's "The Love You Save." ... The story behind the hits, as written by Berry Gordy and narrated in the show by his avatar, Brandon Victor Dixon, is a more depressing matter.
